resources.string:
Reversi is a strategy board game for two players, played on an 8×8 uncheckered board. 

There are sixty-four identical game pieces called disks, which are light on one side and dark on the other. 

Players take turns placing disks on the board with their assigned color facing up. 

During a play, any disks of the opponent's color that are in a straight line and bounded by the disk just placed and another disk of the current player's color are turned over to the current player's color.

The game begins with four disks placed in a square in the middle of the grid, two facing white side up, two pieces with the dark side up, with same-colored disks on a diagonal with each other. 

Convention has initial board position such that the disks with dark side up are to the north-east and south-west.

Dark must place a piece with the dark side up on the board, in such a position that there exists at least one straight (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) occupied line between the new piece and another dark piece, with one or more contiguous light pieces between them.

Players take alternate turns. If one player can not make a valid move, play passes back to the other player. When neither player can move, the game ends.

This occurs when the grid has filled up or when neither player can legally place a piece in any of the remaining squares.

When choosing to play the game you have several options

You can either test your skills against the computer
Or…
Play against a friend on your phone
In the future you will be able to play against other players online

Our game offers two extra features

Extra Move allows the player to make another move in a row!

Skip Turn allows the player to pass its turn to the opponent

 aUse them wisely because they can only be used once in a game
